benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Scenarios TC01 and TC02 cover successful creation with multiple and single tag definitions.
Duplicate Submission: TC13 ensures duplicates in the request are deduplicated in the response.
Large Payloads: TC19 tests behavior with extremely large payloads (and alternative outcomes 201 or 413).

Validation: TC06 (missing header), TC07 (invalid invoice item id format), TC10 (empty tag list), TC11 (invalid tag definition UUID), TC12 (extra/unsupported parameters), TC14 (performance under load), TC18 (malicious payload), TC24 (partial input null/empty), TC25 (timeout).
Server Error Handling: TC08 (not found), TC09 (malformed body), TC16 (unauthorized access), TC17 (service unavailable), TC21 (dependency/service down).
Unauthorized Access: TC16 specifically covers missing/invalid authentication token.
Non-Existing Resource: TC08 verifies 404 for non-existent invoice item.
Malformed JSON: TC09 covers malformed JSON body handling.
Empty Data Scenarios: TC15 validates 404 when database has no invoice items.
Pre-Existing Tags: TC04 validates behavior when an invoice item already has tags.
State Variations: TC22 and TC23 test partially populated DB and maximum tags scenarios.
Integration/Dependency Handling: TC21 tests dependency (tag definition service) unavailability.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior for large result sets or lists of tags when fetching/ listing tags (POST path handles creation, but pagination considerations for subsequent GETs are not tested).
Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache invalidation semantics for write operations.
Rate Limiting: No tests simulate multiple rapid requests or throttling behavior under high request volume.
Concurrency/Race Conditions: While TC14 and TC22 touch performance/state, targeted race-condition tests (e.g., concurrent updates/duplicate creations on the same item) are not explicitly covered.
Partial/Null Values in Array: While TC24 covers partial/null inputs, additional tests around mixed null/undefined array elements and their specific validation messages could be expanded.
Edge Cases on Tag Definition Validation: Additional scenarios around multi-UUID mixed validity (some valid, some invalid) within a single request could be explored.
recommendations: Add pagination-focused tests for GET/list operations or any post-operation fetch that may return paginated results to ensure proper handling of large datasets.
Add caching-related tests to verify ETag/Cache-Control headers and cache invalidation on POST operations.
Introduce rate limiting tests to ensure proper 429 responses or throttling behavior under bursty traffic.
Develop explicit concurrency/race-condition tests, such as multiple simultaneous POST requests to add tags to the same invoice item to validate idempotency and race-safety.
Expand edge-case validation tests for mixed valid/invalid tag definitions in a single payload to ensure consistent error reporting and partial successes if applicable.
